moves.1. d4: In a unrated game you can give your opponent a chance at winning with out effecting your rating or theirs, Game was accepted and white opened with the d4 opening. I opened as black with b5, with the plan to fianchetto my bishop on my Queen side.
moves.3. e5: advance pawn, This move opens the e4 square and now my bishop has a  better position
moves.3... e6: e6 is played and opens up my Queen and my other Bishop. I leave my pawn on b5 hanging, setting a trap to be taken by whites lsb. If taken the Bbxg2 attacking rook. This is important to note that when you take with your B on the home row you leave your Rook's adjacent pawn in-protected.
moves.4. Bxb5: BxP takes the bait  Blunder best move nf3 to develop and protect p on d4.
moves.6... Nc6: I develop my Q side N.
moves.7... Rb8: I relocate my R to the b-file.
moves.9. Qd2: Q is developed this move is a mistake, b3 is a better move to protect the b pawn
moves.9... Rxb2: RxP is taken because of the mistake of developing Q instead of b3
moves.10. Bg5: B is relocated and to attack blacks Q.
moves.10... Ne7: N is moved to block the attack.
moves.11. Nge2: N is developed in front of the K.
moves.12... Qa8: Q is moved to the a-file with possible attack to the h1 square if my B is moved  there
moves.13... Qb7: Q moves to b-file protecting my R.
moves.14... Nxd5: N take of the attacking P on d5
moves.15... Nxc3: Black N is also moved again landing this time on outpost c3
moves.17... Be7: B is developed to e7. attacking whites Bh4.
moves.18... Kxe7: White B is taken by Blacks K who is not able to castle.
moves.19. Qd2: White moves Q to d4, This is another blunder
moves.21. Kf2: Kf2 to get out of check
moves.21... Ne4+:
Last move of the game N e4 forks Q and checks K

This was 21st move and White resigns.
